Package org.opensextant.geodesy

Class Latitude

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.geodesy.Angle
org.opensextant.geodesy.Latitude
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Comparable<Angle>
public class Latitude extends Angle
The Latitude class extends Angle to restrict its value to be between -90° and +90°, and to provide parsing and formatting with hemisphere indicator suffix ('N' or 'S') ser instead of numeric sign.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Latitude

      public Latitude(double value, int unitType)
      This constructor takes latitude angle value and units designator.
      Parameters:
      value - Latitude angular value in specified units (Angle.DEGREES or Angle.RADIANS)
      unitType - Angle.DEGREES or Angle.RADIANS
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if units or value are out of range

    • Latitude

      public Latitude(String latStr)
      This constructor takes a latitude formatted as a string. It looks for a 'N' or 'S' direction indicator suffix character and sets the numeric sign accordingly (N is +, S is -). Units are assumed to be in degrees unless marked as radians.
      Parameters:
      latStr - latitude value string
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if syntax is incorrect or value is out of range

    • Latitude

      public Latitude(double valueInRadians)
      This constructor assumes Latitude angle units are in decimal radians.
      Parameters:
      valueInRadians - Latitude angular value in radians
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if value is out of range (-PI/2 to +PI/2 radians)

    • Latitude

      public Latitude(int degrees, int minutes, double seconds)
      This constructor takes numeric degree, minutes, seconds components for Latitude.
      Parameters:
      degrees - signed, integer degree component of Latitude angular value
      minutes - integer minutes component of Latitude angular value
      seconds - double seconds component of Latitude angular value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - error if a component value is out of range

    • Latitude

      public Latitude(Angle angle)
      This constructor takes an Angle object for Latitude.
      Parameters:
      angle - Angle to use as basis for this Latitude (must be between -90 and +90 degrees)

    • Latitude

      public Latitude()
      The default constructor makes a Latitude object at the Equator (value of zero radians).

  • Method Details

    • init

      protected void init(double value, int unitType)
      Overrides:
      init in class Angle

    • getHemisphere

      public char getHemisphere()
      This accessor method returns the character for the hemisphere of this Latitude ('N' or 'S').
      Returns:
      char indicating southern ('S') or northern ('N') hemisphere

    • inInterval

      public boolean inInterval(Latitude southLat, Latitude northLat)
      This predicate method determines whether this Latitude is within the test interval specified from southLat to northLat.
      Parameters:
      southLat - southern most Latitude of the interval being tested
      northLat - northern most Latitude of the interval being tested
      Returns:
      boolean indicating whether this Latitude is in the test interval

    • toString

      public String toString(int fractDigOfSec)
      This method returns a string version of this latitude value in degree, minute, seconds format, with hemisphere character suffix.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Angle
      Parameters:
      fractDigOfSec - number of fraction digits of seconds to format
      Returns:
      String formatted as integer degrees, minutes, and seconds with optional fractional part
